children.subject:
I think it only covers the in-state portion of tuition, which may be why it is only 'partial.'

In the past, all the CS TA positions were either 10 or 20 hours (10 hours was teaching one section, 20 hours was for 2), but I think they are starting to switch the one section positions to 8 hours now.

history.content:
In addition to below, this link notes exactly which fees are covered, and which aren't.

@1212 has a partial answer to your second question.

Is it true that if you are a uGSI/TA for a class such as 61A/B/C and work 10+ hours per week, you will get your tuition for that semester waived (around $6000)? I read on the website that uGSIs only get partial fee remission -- but $6000 for the semester seems pretty close to the full cost of tuition for that semester. Am I missing something here? I'm trying to comprehend what the website says and I don't understand how fee remission works, exactly -- it would really help if someone could explain it to me in simple terms!

Also, how common are uGSI/TA positions that are 10+ hours a week? (Specifically for classes like the 61 and 16 series.)
history.subject: uGSI fee remissions
